=== Testing Help and Support ===

* There are several ways to ask for help and/or support when it comes to Testing Ubuntu GNOME.

----
==== QA Mailing List ====

 1. '''For Ubuntu GNOME specific Questions and Testing Support''': Ubuntu GNOME QA Team - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntugnome-qa | Mailing List]]</nowiki>

 1. '''For ''General Ubuntu'' Questions and Testing Support''': Ubuntu Quality Team - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/Contact | Mailing List]]</nowiki>

----
==== Ubuntu Forums ====

* For Questions and Support, you may want to use <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=427 | Ubuntu Forums Ubuntu +1 Section]]</nowiki>.

* When you start a '''new thread''', please make sure to use the proper tag:

<nowiki>[[File:UbuntuGNOME/Testing/forums.png]]</nowiki>

<<BR>>

* '''Please Note''': <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=427 | This forum]]</nowiki> is for the discussion of the development of the next version of Ubuntu. Please Note: Ubuntu Developers do not usually read the forums, If you run into what you think is a bug, please use Launchpad to report it.

----
==== IRC ====

 1. '''For Ubuntu GNOME specific Questions and Testing Support''':  Ubuntu GNOME Channel on <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/ContactUs#Live_Chat | IRC]]</nowiki>

 1. '''For ''General Ubuntu'' Questions and Testing Support''': Ubuntu Quality Channel on <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/Contact | IRC]]</nowiki>
